InstructionData.Title: DataLogger Master
InstructionData.Author: Hijel
InstructionData.Instructions:
#Master Data Logger Code to be used with the Stationeers Data Logger Windows App #Found at: https://github.com/HijelHub/Stationeers_Data_Logger #------------------------------------------------------------------------ #*** EDIT! Choose the housings you are getting the variables from ("Process" housings) *** alias ProcessHousing d0 #alias IC10HousingName1 d1 #alias IC10HousingName2 d2 #alias IC10HousingName3 d3 #alias IC10HousingName4 d4 #alias IC10HousingName5 d5 # Don't forget to set the above items on the housing with the screwdriver #------------------------------------------------------------------------ # *** EDIT! The following constants need to be set correctly on all logger housings *** #Change the LoggingInterval to your desired wait time between logging events define LoggingInterval 0.5 #Seconds | lowest useful value is 0.5 #Change VariableCount to the number of variables you want to log on each packet define VariableCount 2 #------------------------------------------------------------------------ #Clear the stack jal MASTERLOGGER.CLEAR #Reserve and setup variable registers alias IterationCounter r15 alias TimeSleep r14 move IterationCounter 0 mul TimeSleep LoggingInterval 2 #------------------------------------------------------------------------ MASTERLOGGER.LOG: #Update the iteration counter add IterationCounter IterationCounter 1 #Display the iteration counter on the housing for slave dataloggers to use s db Setting IterationCounter #Check that there is room in the stack jal MASTERLOGGER.CHECKSTACK #Get the remote variables from the Process Housing(s) on the network #------------------------------------------------------------------------ #*** EDIT! THIS PORTION TO REFLECT THE VARIABLES YOU WANT TO GET *** get r0 ProcessHousing 0 get r1 ProcessHousing 1 #etc... # Write the iteration counter and variables to the stack (the "packet") push IterationCounter push r0 push r1 #etc... #------------------------------------------------------------------------ #Wait until the next required cycle j MASTERLOGGER.WAIT
MASTERLOGGER.CHECKSTACK: # check to see if next data packet will fit on the stack, if not loop back to sp 0 add r13 VariableCount 1 add r12 sp r13 blt r12 511 ra move sp 0 j ra
MASTERLOGGER.WAIT: #not using Sleep function to allow sub second waits sub TimeSleep TimeSleep 1 yield brgtz TimeSleep -2 mul TimeSleep LoggingInterval 2 j MASTERLOGGER.LOG
MASTERLOGGER.CLEAR: #let other data logger housings know to clear their stack memory s db Setting -1 yield #Clear this housings stack memory clr db move sp 0 yield j ra
